title: Oil Pump End Clearance

body.body: Remove the end plate from the pump.
Wipe the exposed areas of the rotors and the machined face of the end plate.
The oil pump end clearance is measured using Plastigauge (Triumph part number 3880150-T0301). Do not turn the oil pump during the clearance measurement as this will damage the 'Plastigauge'.
Apply a thin smear of grease to the rotor and a small quantity of silicone release agent to the face of the end plate.
Cut a length of the Plastigauge to fit across the rotor. Fit the strip to the rotor using the grease to hold the Plastigauge in place.
Without any twisting action, refit the oil pump cover and tighten its fixings to
Release the bolts and carefully remove the end plate.
Using the gauge provided with the Plastigauge kit, measure the width of the compressed Plastigauge.

body.name: Oil Pump End Clearance plastigauge cdqi_2 .svg)

body.body: If the clearance measured is within the specified tolerance, clean off all traces of Plastigauge from the outer rotor and oil pump cover.
If any clearance measured is outside the service limits, renew the complete pump.
